title: How to Keep a Schnauzer's Face White

steps.title: Clean its beard after its last meal of the day.
steps.content: Clean its beard after its last meal of the day. Use a natural dog shampoo to clean your schnauzer's beard. [1] X Expert Source Lancy Woo Certified Pet Groomer Expert Interview. 26 February 2020. Make sure to rinse its beard until all of the shampoo is removed. Blow dry the hair on a cool setting until it is completely dry. Be careful when blow-drying your dog's hair, as dogs are sound sensitive. If your dog becomes stressed or fearful, take a break or use a towel to dry their hair instead. [2] X Expert Source Lancy Woo Certified Pet Groomer Expert Interview. 26 February 2020. Alternatively, wet a cloth with warm water. Wipe your schnauzer’s beard with the cloth to remove food and other debris that can cause staining.

steps.title: Wipe its eyes with a warm cloth.
steps.content: Wipe its eyes with a warm cloth. Dampen a cloth with warm water. At the end of each day, wipe around your schnauzer’s eyes to remove eye matter and build up that can cause staining. [3] X Research source You can also purchase specific products to help clear up eye stains at your local pet supply store or online.

steps.title: Trim its facial hair every five to eight weeks.
steps.content: Trim its facial hair every five to eight weeks. Take your schnauzer to the groomer to have the hair on its face and around its eyes trimmed. Long hair around your schnauzer's eyes can poke and irritate them, causing tearing and staining. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Additionally, trimming your schnauzer's hair periodically will promote new hair growth, making room for new, white hair.

steps.title: Feed your schnauzer a high-quality dog food.
steps.content: Feed your schnauzer a high-quality dog food. Feeding your schnauzer a high-quality dog food may help reduce staining on its face. Choose a dog food that is high in protein and low in grains and cereals. The first two to three ingredients listed should be a protein like beef, lamb, poultry, or fish. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Additionally, choose a dog food that contains high-quality byproducts such as organs and entrails.

steps.title: Avoid foods that contain artificial coloring.
steps.content: Avoid foods that contain artificial coloring. Dog food and treats that contain artificial coloring will stain your schnauzer’s face. If you want to keep your schnauzer’s face white, choose a brand that contains zero artificial colors. [6] X Research source Choose white or pale-colored treats and biscuits over colored treats and biscuits.

steps.title: Provide filtered water.
steps.content: Provide filtered water. Faucet water is more likely to contain hard minerals like iron that can stain your schnauzer’s face. Instead, provide your dog with filtered water from water bottles or a water filtration system. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of apple cider vinegar to its water.
steps.content: Add 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of apple cider vinegar to its water. Add apple cider vinegar to your schnauzer’s water for three to four weeks. After three weeks, repeat this every two months. [8] X Research source Some people report that adding apple cider vinegar will further purify the water, reducing the chances of staining in your schnauzer’s face.

steps.title: Supplement its food with probiotics.
steps.content: Supplement its food with probiotics. Supplementing your schnauzer’s diet with probiotics can help maintain your dog's coat and appearance. Probiotics come in either a powder or a liquid form. Administer the probiotics per the instructions on the bottle. [9] X Research source You can purchase dog probiotics online or from your local pet supply store. Talk to your vet before giving your dog any supplements.

steps.title: Clean and dust your house twice a month.
steps.content: Clean and dust your house twice a month. An allergic reaction to dust and other seasonal allergens can cause tears and mucus to stain your schnauzer’s white face. To prevent this from happening, dust your house often, especially during allergy seasons. [10] X Research source Change your air filters every two to three months.

steps.title: Use stainless steel water and food bowls.
steps.content: Use stainless steel water and food bowls. Plastic food and water bowls tend to absorb colors and odors from dog food and water. These colors can transfer to your schnauzer’s face while they eat and drink, causing staining. Instead, use stainless steel, glass, or ceramic food and water bowls. Alternatively, a dog water bottle is a great way to keep your schnauzer’s face dry and clean.

steps.title: Take your schnauzer to the vet.
steps.content: Take your schnauzer to the vet. If staining is still an issue, you should consider taking your dog to the vet. While some staining is ok, excessive and persistent staining can be a sign of a mild to severe health issue. [11] X Research source For example, periodontal disease, fractured teeth, oral tumors, eye infections, allergies, eye abrasions, and face and mouth abnormalities can all cause excessive staining in schnauzers.
